The code also references coverage for agricultural labor and domestic service. Further, WorkForce West Virginia requires an Employer’s Initial Statement (Form UC‑A‑154) to be filed and issues an account number after review; employers must register for withholding through the State Tax Department. The U.S. Department of Labor contact list provides the phone number for WorkForce West Virginia’s employer tax unit【48761910951811†L348-L479】.

agency_name: Wisconsin Department of Workforce Development (Unemployment Insurance Division) and Wisconsin Department of Revenue
ui_wage_threshold_text: Commercial employers become covered in Wisconsin if they pay $1,500 or more in wages in a calendar quarter or have one or more employees for some part of a day in 20 different weeks during a calendar year. Agricultural employers are liable when they pay $20,000 or more in cash wages in a quarter or employ 10 or more workers during 20 weeks. Domestic employers become covered when they pay $1,000 or more in cash wages in a quarter. 501(c)(3) nonprofit organizations become liable when they have four or more employees for some portion of a day in 20 weeks. An employer subject to the Federal Unemployment Tax Act (FUTA) is also covered.
ui_threshold_weeks_text: 20 different weeks with at least one employee for commercial employers; 20 weeks with 10 or more workers for agricultural employers; 20 weeks with four or more employees for nonprofit employers; there is no weeks test for household employment.
withholding_threshold_description: Employers must register for a Wisconsin withholding tax account and withhold state income tax on wages paid to employees whenever federal withholding is required. There is no minimum wage threshold.
typical_processing_time: The Department of Workforce Development’s online New Employer Registration assigns a Wisconsin unemployment account number upon completion; the Department of Revenue usually issues a withholding tax number within a few business days of registering online.
required_information: Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN)
Legal business name and trade name
Physical and mailing addresses and phone
Type of business entity and date formed
Date employees first performed services in Wisconsin and date first wages were paid
Total quarterly wages and number of employees
Names, titles, Social Security numbers and addresses of owners, partners, members or corporate officers
Business activity and NAICS code
Predecessor or successor business information
Payroll contact person and email
For nonprofits, copy of IRS determination letter
filing_methods: Register online through the Wisconsin Department of Workforce Development’s New Employer Registration portal to obtain an unemployment account number
Register for a Wisconsin withholding tax number through the Department of Revenue’s tax system (My Tax Account or Business Tax Registration) or by mailing Form WT‑7
File quarterly wage reports and unemployment tax reports electronically and remit withholding taxes via the My Tax Account or by mail.
confirmation_proof: The Department of Workforce Development sends an employer unemployment account number and contribution rate notice once registration is approved; the Department of Revenue issues a Wisconsin withholding tax number and deposit schedule.

contacts.phone: 608‑266‑3131 (DWD Employer Service for UI), 608‑266‑2776 (Department of Revenue)

source_notes: The Wisconsin Employer Handbook explains that commercial employers become covered when they pay $1,500 or more in wages in a quarter or have one or more employees for some part of a day in 20 weeks, agricultural employers are liable when they pay $20,000 in cash wages or employ 10 or more workers in 20 weeks, domestic employers become covered at $1,000 cash wages, and nonprofit employers are liable at four employees in 20 weeks【291439343101585†L119-L146】. The handbook also notes that coverage is retroactive to January 1 of the year when liability is met【291439343101585†L93-L104】. Employers must register using the New Employer Registration portal to obtain an unemployment account number and register with the Department of Revenue for withholding.

notes: Coverage is retroactive to January 1 of the year when liability is met.

agency_name: Wyoming Department of Workforce Services – Unemployment Insurance Division
ui_wage_threshold_text: Wyoming employers are liable for unemployment insurance tax when they pay $1,500 or more in wages during a calendar quarter or employ at least one worker for some part of a day in each of 20 different weeks in a calendar year. Agricultural employers are liable when they pay $20,000 or more in wages in a quarter or employ 10 or more workers in agricultural labor for 20 weeks. Domestic employers become liable when they pay $1,000 or more in cash wages in a quarter. Nonprofit employers become liable when they employ four or more workers for some portion of a day in each of 20 weeks. Employers subject to FUTA or who acquire a liable business are also covered.
ui_threshold_weeks_text: 20 different weeks with at least one employee for general employers; 20 weeks with 10 or more workers for agricultural employers; 20 weeks with four or more workers for nonprofits.
withholding_threshold_description: Wyoming does not levy a state income tax; employers are not required to register for or withhold state income tax.
typical_processing_time: Employers who register online through the Wyoming Unemployment Insurance (WYUI) portal generally receive their unemployment account number within a few business days; paper applications may take longer.
required_information: Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN)
Legal business name and trade name
Physical and mailing addresses and phone number
Type of business entity and date formed
Date employees first performed services in Wyoming and date first wages were paid
Total quarterly wages and number of employees
Names, titles, Social Security numbers and addresses of owners, partners, members or corporate officers
Business activity and NAICS code
Information on acquired businesses or successors
Payroll contact person and email
Whether the employer is agricultural, domestic or nonprofit.
filing_methods: Register online via the Wyoming Department of Workforce Services Unemployment Insurance Employer Portal to obtain an unemployment account number
Submit a paper Employer Registration Form to the Department if online registration is not available
After registration, file quarterly wage reports and remit unemployment contributions through the WYUI portal.
confirmation_proof: The Wyoming Department of Workforce Services sends an unemployment insurance employer account number and contribution rate notice after processing the registration.
source_notes: Wyoming does not levy a state income tax, so employers only register for unemployment insurance. While state statutes specify that coverage applies to employers paying $1,500 in wages or employing a worker for 20 weeks, official sources are not easily accessible; this entry uses the standard FUTA thresholds for general, agricultural, domestic and nonprofit employers as shown in the U.S. Department of Labor comparative analysis tables. The U.S. Department of Labor contact list provides the phone number for the Wyoming Unemployment Insurance tax division【48761910951811†L348-L479】.

agency_name: District of Columbia Department of Employment Services (DOES)
ui_wage_threshold_text: Most employers become liable for unemployment taxes on the first day wages are paid to any individual; household employers become liable once $500 or more in aggregate wages are paid in a calendar quarter
withholding_threshold_description: Every employer who pays wages to a DC resident or withholds DC income tax from employees must register for a DC withholding account using the Combined Registration Application (Form FR‑500); employers must report the number of DC resident employees, the date they began employing DC residents and the amount of tax to withhold
typical_processing_time: Online registration through the Employer Self‑Service Portal assigns a six‑digit unemployment account number upon completion; Form FR‑500 registrations through MyTax DC typically process within a few business days
required_information: Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN)
Legal name and trade name of the business
Business mailing and physical addresses, email and phone number
Date first wages were paid in DC and estimated number of employees
Number of DC resident employees and expected start date for withholding
Estimated monthly DC tax to be withheld
Description of business activities and date incorporated
filing_methods: Online via Employer Self‑Service Portal (ESSP) for unemployment tax registration
Paper Form FR‑500 available on request for household employers with five or fewer employees
Combined Registration Application (Form FR‑500) via MyTax DC for withholding and other business taxes
confirmation_proof: Unique six‑digit unemployment account number issued by DOES; DC withholding registration produces a DC taxpayer ID number
source_notes: DC UI Employer Handbook – liability and registration requirements; FR‑500 form fields for DC withholding registration

notes: Most employers become liable on the first day wages are paid (first-dollar coverage)
